page.title: 08Hockley Woods near Rayleigh
page.content: Hockley Woods is an ancient woodland covering 250acres.Woodland has existed here since the last Ice Age.The domin_ ant trees are Oak,Sweet Chestnut,Horn_ beam & birch.The presence of Wild Ser_ vice,Common Cow_wheat and Wood Spurge etc indicate ancient woodland.It is an area of S.S.I.now owned by Rochford council who manage the woodland and protect many species of trees and pla_ nts.They regularly coppice 12acreas of woodland each year within a 10_20 year cycle.This extends the life of the tr_ ees by encouraging new growth.The inc_ reased light stimulates growth in low growing vegetation.Wood is used to make gates,bridges,way markers,track edging,firewood,fencing,& dead hedging It is also used to assist drainage and preservation of footpaths & bridleways They are also encouraging interest in many woodland crafts.
